                java.awt.Dimension dimensions,
                @NonNull
                java.awt.Point position)
        Constructs a new TileGrid.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - The dimensions of the grid.
        position - The position of the grid within it's parent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the dimensions or position is null.

    • Method Detail

      • drawTile

        public void drawTile(java.awt.Graphics2D gc,
                     ImageCache imageCache,
                     int tileX,
                     int tileY,
                     int drawX,
                     int drawY)
        Draws a specific tile to the screen. If there are any child grids which have tiles overlapping the position of the tile to draw, then those tiles are drawn as well.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context to draw with.
        imageCache - The image cache to retrieve tile images from.
        tileX - The x-axis position of the tile, on this grid, to draw.
        tileY - The y-axis position of the tile, on this grid, to draw.
        drawX - The x-axis position, on the screen, to draw the tile at.
        drawY - The y-axis position, on the screen, to draw the tile at.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • convertToGraphicTileGrid

        public void convertToGraphicTileGrid()
        Converts this TileGrid and all of it's children to use GraphicTiles, rather than regular Tiles.

      • convertToTileGrid

        public void convertToTileGrid()
        Converts this TileGrid and all of it's children to use Tiles, rather than GraphicTiles.

      • addChild

        public void addChild(TileGrid child)
        Adds a child grid to the grid, so that it renders before all other children. The child is ignored if it's null.
        Parameters:
        child - The child.

      • addChildAfter

        public void addChildAfter(TileGrid newChild,
                          TileGrid existingChild)
        Adds a child grid to the grid, so that it renders before an existing child in the grid. The new child is ignored if it's null. If the existing child is null, or if it's not in the grid, then the function falls back to the addChlld function.
        Parameters:
        newChild - The new child.
        existingChild - The existing child.

      • addChildBefore

        public void addChildBefore(TileGrid newChild,
                           TileGrid existingChild)
        Adds a child grid to the grid, so that it renders after an existing child in the grid. The child is ignored if it's null. If the existing child is null, of if it's not in the grid, then the function falls back to the addChild function.
        Parameters:
        newChild - The new child.
        existingChild - The existing child.

      • removeChild

        public void removeChild(TileGrid child)
        Removes a child grid from the grid. The child is ignored if it's null.
        Parameters:
        child - The child.

      • containsChild

        public boolean containsChild(TileGrid child)
        Determines whether or not the grid contains a specific child.
        Parameters:
        child - The child.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the grid contains the child.

      • getPositionHash

        public long getPositionHash(int tileX,
                            int tileY)
        Calculates the hash value of a specific tile. If there are any child grids which have tiles overlapping the position of the tile to calculate the hash for, then the hashes of those tiles are added to the hash of the tile.
        Parameters:
        tileX - The x-axis position of the tile, on this grid, to calculate the hash for.
        tileY - The y-axis position of the tile, on this grid, to calculate the hash for.
        Returns:
        The hash.

      • getRow

        public Tile[] getRow(int index)
        Retrieves a row of tiles. If the index is less than 0, then an empty array is returned. If the index exceeds the grid's height, then an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the row.
        Returns:
        The row of tiles.

      • getColumn

        public Tile[] getColumn(int columnIndex)
        Retrieves a column of tiles. If the index is less than 0, then an empty array is returned. If the index exceeds the grid's width, then an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column.
        Returns:
        The column of tiles.

      • getRowSubset

        public Tile[] getRowSubset(int rowIndex,
                           int columnIndex,
                           int length)
        Retrieves a subset of tiles from a row. If the row or column indices are negative, then an empty array is returned. If the length is less than 1, then an empty array is returned. If the row index exceeds the grid's width, then an empty array is returned. If the column index exceeds the grid's width, then an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The index of the row.
        columnIndex - The index of the column to begin the subset at.
        length - The number of columns to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The subset.

      • getColumnSubset

        public Tile[] getColumnSubset(int rowIndex,
                              int columnIndex,
                              int length)
        Retrieves a subset of tiles from a column. If the row or column indices are negative, then an empty array is returned. If the length is less than 1, then an empty array is returned. If the row index exceeds the grid's width, then an empty array is returned. If the column index exceeds the grid's width, then an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The index of the row to begin the subset at.
        columnIndex - The index of the column.
        length - The number of rows to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The subset.

      • getRectangularSubset

        public Tile[][] getRectangularSubset(int startRow,
                                     int startColumn,
                                     int width,
                                     int height)
        Retrieves a rectangular subset of tiles from the grid. The tiles are ordered first by row, then by column. The point (5x, 10y) would be at 'subset[10][5]'. If the width or height are less than 1, then an empty array is returned. If the start row or column is greater than the width/height of the grid, then an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        startRow - The index of the column to begin the subset at.
        startColumn - The index of the row to begin the subset at.
        width - The width of the subset to retrieve.
        height - The height of the subset to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The subset.

      • getTotalChildren

        public int getTotalChildren()
        Retrieves the total number of child grids.
        Returns:
        The total number of child grids.

      • getXPosition

        public int getXPosition()
        Retrieves the x-axis coordinate of the grid within it's parent.
        Returns:
        The x-axis coordinate of the grid within it's parent.

      • getYPosition

        public int getYPosition()
        Retrieves the y-axis coordinate of the grid within it's parent.
        Returns:
        The y-axis coordinate of the grid within it's parent.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Retrieves the width, also known as the total number of columns, in the grid.
        Returns:
        The width of the grid.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Retrieves the height, also known as the total number of rows, in the grid.
        Returns:
        The height of the grid.

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int x,
                      int y)
        Retrieves a tile from the grid.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-axis coordinate of the tile to retrieve.
        y - The y-axis coordinate of the tile to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The tile, or null if the coordinates are outside the bounds of the grid.

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(java.awt.Point position)
        Retrieves a tile from the grid.
        Parameters:
        position - The x/y-axis coordinates of the tile to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The tile, or null if the coordinates are outside the bounds of the grid.

                        int y)
        Sets the new x/y-axis coordinates of the grid within it's parent.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-axis coordinate.
        y - The new y-axis coordinate.
